718276f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Mall.
718276f-a.text:
Central Park, the Mall: An open-air concert at the Music Pavilion. Facing the pavilion, and with its back to the camera, stands the bust of Beethoven, by Baerer, erected in 1884 by the Mannerchor German singing society (Gesangverein).
About 1912..
M. Rosenfeld, Photographer.
Gift of Musical America.
Neg #2862
718276f-a.folder: Central Park & The Mall., Manhattan, NY

718268f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Mall.
718268f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Mall, crowd with roller skaters. During this and the following year, this sport, always more or less popular, suddenly became a craze; young, middle aged, and old, children and adults all took to roller skates. The Mall and the Central Park walks, together with the east sidewalk of Central Park West, were favorite locations, but by no means the only ones.
May 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same another view.
The seated statue represents Fitz-Creene Halleck, by Wilson
MacDonald (erected in 1877).
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
718268f-c.folder: Central Park & The Mall., Manhattan, NY
